00040 /// To be called a BGP file, the file requires
00041 class affx::BgpFile {
00042 public:
00043   affx::TsvFile m_tsv; ///< public so people can work with it
00044 
00045   //#%header0=probset_id probe_id
00046   int         probe_id;
00047         int         probeset_id_1;
00048   int         atom_id;
00049   int         exon_position;
00050   int         gc_count;
00051         int         interrogation_position;
00052         int         probe_length;
00053   std::string probe_sequence;
00054   int         probeset_id_2;
00055         std::string probeset_name;
00056         std::string type;
00057         int         x;
00058         int         y;
00059 
00060   /// @brief     Create the BgpFile object
00061   BgpFile();
00062   /// @brief     Destroy a BgpFile object
00063   ~BgpFile();
00064 
00065   /// @brief     Clears all the member vars.
00066   void clear();
00067 
00068   /// @brief     Make the bindings which define a BGP file
00069   void makeBgpBindings();
00070 
00071   /// @brief     Open a BGP file
00072   /// @param     filename     the pathname of the file
00073   /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00074   int open(const std::string& filename);
00075 
00076   /// @brief     Start the write to a file
00077   /// @param     filename
00078   /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00079   int write(const std::string& filename);
00080   /// @brief     Close a PGF file
00081   /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00082   int close();
00083   /// @brief     Rewind back to the start of the BGP data
00084   /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00085   int rewind();
00086   /// @brief     Skip to the next probe
00087   /// @returns   TSV_LEVEL_LAST when out of probesets
00088   int next_bgprobe();
00089   /// @brief     Define a tsv file as a BGP file.
00090   /// @param     tsv       pointer to tsv to define
00091   /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00092   int defineFileBgp(TsvFile* tsv);
00093   /// @brief     Define this file as a pgf file
00094   /// @returns   tsv_return_t
00095   int defineFileBgp();
00096 };
